thread.title: Pub garden smoking ban to be dropped over fears of job losses
thread.title_full: Pub garden smoking ban to be dropped over fears of job losses

author: Steven Swinford, Political Editor, The Times
title: Pub garden smoking ban to be dropped over fears of job losses
text:
Ministers say a ban on outdoor smoking in cafés, pubs and restaurant gardens could cause a backlash from the hospitality industry and some voters new Steven Swinford , Political Editor, The Times Thursday October 24 2024, 10.15pm, The Times Wrangling over the extent of the smoking ban has delayed the Tobacco and Vapes Bill YUI MOK/PA WIRE Steven Swinford , Political Editor, The Times Thursday October 24 2024, 10.15pm, The Times No 10 and ministers are backing away from plans to ban smoking in public spaces in response to fears that it will cause “serious economic harm” to the hospitality industry.
Downing Street is said to have significant concerns about the policy after warnings that it could lead to job losses and pub closures.
The Times disclosed last month that Wes Streeting , the health secretary, was having second thoughts about the policy, saying he would not go ahead with the ban unless voters want it.
Downing Street fears an outdoor smoking ban could lead to job losses and pub closures HOLLIE ADAMS/REUTERS While a ban on smoking outside hospitals, schools and in playgrounds is seen as almost certain, ministers are worried there will be a backlash from the hospitality industry and some voters if the ban extends to café, pub and restaurant
